name: Django
description: Django is a high-level Python web framework that encourages rapid development and clean, pragmatic design.

name: Ruby on Rails
description: Ruby on Rails is a web application framework written in Ruby that follows the Model-View-Controller (MVC) architectural pattern.

name: Angular
description: Angular is a platform and framework for building client-side applications using TypeScript and the Model-View-Controller (MVC) pattern.

name: React
description: React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces, particularly single-page applications.

name: Vue.js
description: Vue.js is a progressive JavaScript framework for building user interfaces, designed to be incrementally adoptable.

name: Spring
description: Spring is a Java framework that provides comprehensive infrastructure support for building Java applications.

name: .NET Core
description: .NET Core is an open-source, cross-platform framework for building modern, cloud-based, and internet-connected applications.

name: Express.js
description: Express.js is a fast, unopinionated, minimalist web framework for Node.js, designed for building web applications and APIs.

name: Flask
description: Flask is a lightweight Python web framework that's easy to use and designed to make getting started quick and easy.

name: Laravel
description: Laravel is a PHP web application framework known for its elegant syntax and features like routing, authentication, and caching.

name: Symfony
description: Symfony is a set of reusable PHP components and a web application framework that follows the Model-View-Controller (MVC) pattern.

name: ASP.NET
description: ASP.NET is a web framework developed by Microsoft for building dynamic web applications, web services, and websites.

name: Ember.js
description: Ember.js is a JavaScript framework for building ambitious web applications that handles the boilerplate and provides conventions.

name: Qt
description: Qt is a C++ framework for developing cross-platform applications, including user interfaces and device-specific features.

name: TensorFlow
description: TensorFlow is an open-source machine learning framework developed by Google for building and training neural network models.

name: PyTorch
description: PyTorch is an open-source machine learning framework that provides a flexible, dynamic approach to building and training models.

name: Ionic
description: Ionic is a popular open-source framework for building cross-platform mobile applications using web technologies like HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

name: RubyMotion
description: RubyMotion is a framework for building native applications on iOS, Android, macOS, and more using the Ruby programming language.

name: Meteor
description: Meteor is a full-stack JavaScript framework for building real-time web applications, including both the front-end and back-end.

name: Django REST framework
description: Django REST framework is a powerful toolkit for building Web APIs in Django applications.

name: NestJS
description: NestJS is a TypeScript-based Node.js framework for building efficient and scalable server-side applications.

name: Ruby Grape
description: Ruby Grape is a micro-framework for creating REST-like APIs in Ruby.

name: ASP.NET Core
description: ASP.NET Core is the cross-platform version of ASP.NET, suitable for building modern web applications and APIs.

name: Koa
description: Koa is a modern web framework for Node.js that aims to be smaller, more expressive, and more robust.

name: Slim
description: Slim is a PHP micro framework that's ideal for building simple, yet powerful web applications and APIs.

name: Feathers
description: Feathers is a web framework for building real-time applications using JavaScript or TypeScript across various platforms.

name: Sails.js
description: Sails.js is a full-featured MVC framework for building web applications and APIs using Node.js.

name: Phoenix
description: Phoenix is a web framework for building real-time, fault-tolerant, and distributed systems using Elixir.

name: Nuxt.js
description: Nuxt.js is a higher-level framework built on top of Vue.js, designed for creating universal and single page applications.

name: Quasar Framework
description: Quasar Framework is a high-performance, responsive design framework for building websites, mobile apps, and Electron apps using Vue.js.

name: Python
description: Python is an interpreted, high-level and general-purpose programming language.

name: Java
description: Java is a general-purpose programming language that is class-based, object-oriented, and designed to have as few implementation dependencies as possible.

name: C
description: C is a general-purpose, procedural computer programming language supporting structured programming, lexical variable scope, and recursion, with a static type system.

name: C++
description: C++ is a general-purpose programming language created as an extension of the C programming language, providing object-oriented and generic programming features.

name: C#
description: C# is a general-purpose, multi-paradigm programming language encompassing strong typing, lexically scoped, imperative, declarative, functional, generic, object-oriented, and component-oriented programming disciplines.

name: JavaScript
description: JavaScript is a high-level, interpreted scripting language used to create dynamic and interactive websites.

name: Ruby
description: Ruby is a dynamic, interpreted, reflective, object-oriented, general-purpose programming language.

name: Swift
description: Swift is a general-purpose, multi-paradigm programming language developed by Apple Inc. for iOS, iPadOS, macOS, watchOS, tvOS, and Linux.

name: Kotlin
description: Kotlin is a statically typed programming language that runs on the Java Virtual Machine and also can be compiled to JavaScript source code or uses the LLVM compiler infrastructure.

name: PHP
description: PHP is a server-side scripting language designed for web development but also used as a general-purpose programming language.

name: Go
description: Go (also known as Golang) is an open-source programming language created by Google. It is statically typed, compiled, and focuses on simplicity and efficiency.

name: Rust
description: Rust is a systems programming language that aims to provide the speed of C and C++ while also focusing on memory safety and thread safety.

name: Perl
description: Perl is a high-level, general-purpose, interpreted, dynamic programming language.

name: Haskell
description: Haskell is a functional programming language that emphasizes a concise, declarative coding style.

name: Scala
description: Scala is a general-purpose programming language that integrates functional and object-oriented programming.

name: R
description: R is a programming language and free software environment used for statistical computing and graphics.

name: Lua
description: Lua is a lightweight, high-level, multi-paradigm programming language designed primarily for embedded systems and games.

name: TypeScript
description: TypeScript is a strict syntactical superset of JavaScript that adds optional static typing, interfaces, and other advanced features.

name: Julia
description: Julia is a high-level, high-performance programming language for technical computing, with syntax that is familiar to users of other technical computing environments.

name: Dart
description: Dart is a programming language designed for building web, server, and mobile applications.

name: Cobol
description: COBOL is a compiled English-like computer programming language designed for business use.

name: Erlang
description: Erlang is a general-purpose, concurrent, functional programming language used primarily in telecommunications and other high-availability systems.

name: Groovy
description: Groovy is a dynamic programming language that runs on the Java Virtual Machine and can be used as both a programming language and a scripting language.

name: Haxe
description: Haxe is a high-level, open-source programming language that can be compiled to various target languages, including JavaScript, C++, and more.

name: Io
description: Io is a small, prototype-based programming language inspired by Smalltalk, Lisp, and other languages.

name: J
description: J is a high-level, interpreted programming language, primarily used for mathematical and statistical analysis.

name: Maxima
description: Maxima is a computer algebra system based on a 1982 version of Macsyma.

name: ML
description: ML is a general-purpose functional programming language developed by Robin Milner and others in the early 1970s.

name: Nim
description: Nim is a statically typed, imperative programming language that focuses on performance, portability, and expressiveness.

name: Objective-C
description: Objective-C is a general-purpose, object-oriented programming language used by Apple for the macOS and iOS operating systems.

name: OCaml
description: OCaml is a general-purpose, functional, and imperative programming language.

name: Pascal
description: Pascal is an influential imperative and procedural programming language, designed in the late 1960s as a small and efficient language intended to encourage good programming practices.

name: PL/I
description: PL/I is a procedural, imperative computer programming language designed for scientific, engineering, business, and systems programming applications.

name: PostScript
description: PostScript is a page description language and programming language used primarily in the electronic and desktop publishing areas.

name: PowerShell
description: PowerShell is a task automation and configuration management framework from Microsoft, consisting of a command-line shell and associated scripting language.

name: PureScript
description: PureScript is a strongly-typed functional programming language that compiles to JavaScript.

name: REXX
description: REXX is an interpreted language that is used primarily for text processing.

name: Ring
description: Ring is a dynamic and general-purpose programming language that is designed to be simple and easy to learn.

name: SAS
description: SAS is a software suite used for advanced analytics, business intelligence, and data management.

name: Scratch
description: Scratch is a visual programming language and online community where users can create their own interactive stories, games, and animations.

name: Tcl
description: Tcl is a high-level, dynamic programming language often used for rapid prototyping and scripting.

name: Turing
description: Turing is a Pascal-like programming language developed for teaching programming concepts to beginners.

name: Vim script
description: Vim script is a scripting language used for customizing and extending the Vim text editor.

name: Visual Basic
description: Visual Basic is a third-generation event-driven programming language from Microsoft.

name: X10
description: X10 is a high-level programming language that is designed for high-performance, high-productivity computing.

name: Zig
description: Zig is a general-purpose programming language designed for robustness, optimality, and maintainability.

name: Visual Studio Code
description: Visual Studio Code is a free source-code editor made by Microsoft for Windows, Linux, and macOS.

name: IntelliJ IDEA
description: IntelliJ IDEA is a powerful Java integrated development environment (IDE) for developing computer software.

name: Eclipse
description: Eclipse is an integrated development environment (IDE) used in computer programming.

name: PyCharm
description: PyCharm is an integrated development environment (IDE) used in computer programming for Python language.

name: Sublime Text
description: Sublime Text is a proprietary cross-platform source code editor with a Python application programming interface (API).

name: Atom
description: Atom is a free and open-source text and source code editor for macOS, Linux, and Microsoft Windows.

name: Visual Studio
description: Visual Studio is an integrated development environment (IDE) developed by Microsoft.

name: NetBeans
description: NetBeans is an integrated development environment (IDE) for Java. It supports development of all Java application types.

name: Xcode
description: Xcode is an integrated development environment (IDE) for macOS containing a suite of software development tools.

name: Android Studio
description: Android Studio is the official integrated development environment (IDE) for Android application development.

name: Git
description: Git is a distributed version control system for tracking changes in source code during software development.

name: GitHub
description: GitHub is a web-based platform for version control and collaboration using Git.

name: Jupyter Notebook
description: Jupyter Notebook is an open-source web application that allows you to create and share documents that contain live code, equations, visualizations, and narrative text.

name: Docker
description: Docker is a set of platform as a service (PaaS) products that use OS-level virtualization to deliver software in packages called containers.

name: Postman
description: Postman is a collaboration platform for API development that simplifies the process of developing APIs that allow software to communicate.

name: Webpack
description: Webpack is an open-source JavaScript module bundler. It takes modules with dependencies and generates static assets representing those modules.

name: npm
description: npm is a package manager for the JavaScript programming language.

name: Selenium
description: Selenium is a portable framework for testing web applications. Selenium provides a playback tool for authoring functional tests.

name: Visual Studio Online
description: Visual Studio Online is a web-based integrated development environment (IDE) for software developers.

name: CMake
description: CMake is an open-source, cross-platform family of tools designed to build, test, and package software.

name: JIRA
description: JIRA is a proprietary issue tracking product developed by Atlassian that allows bug tracking and agile project management.

name: Confluence
description: Confluence is a web-based corporate wiki application developed by Atlassian.

name: Slack
description: Slack is a proprietary business communication platform that offers many IRC-style features.

name: Trello
description: Trello is a web-based list-making application originally made by Fog Creek Software in 2011, that was spun out to form the basis of a separate company in 2014.

name: Vagrant
description: Vagrant is an open-source software product for building and maintaining portable virtual software development environments.

name: Ansible
description: Ansible is an open-source automation tool that automates software provisioning, configuration management, and application deployment.

name: Version Control
description: Version control is a system that records changes to a file or set of files over time, so that you can recall specific versions later.

name: Agile
description: Agile is an iterative approach to software development that emphasizes flexibility, collaboration, and customer feedback.

name: DevOps
description: DevOps is a set of practices that combines software development (Dev) and IT operations (Ops) to shorten the software development life cycle and improve deployment frequency.

name: Algorithm
description: An algorithm is a step-by-step procedure or formula for solving a problem or accomplishing a task.

name: Data Structure
description: A data structure is a way of organizing and storing data in a computer so that it can be used efficiently.

name: API
description: An API (Application Programming Interface) is a set of rules and protocols that allows different software applications to communicate with each other.

name: Database
description: A database is an organized collection of structured information, or data, typically stored electronically in a computer system.

name: Cloud Computing
description: Cloud computing is the delivery of computing servicesâ€”servers, storage, databases, networking, software, over the Cloud (Internet).

name: Machine Learning
description: Machine learning is a subset of artificial intelligence that involves training computers to learn from data and improve their performance over time.

name: Artificial Intelligence
description: Artificial intelligence (AI) is the simulation of human intelligence in machines that are capable of performing tasks that typically require human intelligence.

name: Big Data
description: Big data refers to extremely large datasets that may be analyzed computationally to reveal patterns, trends, and associations.

name: Cybersecurity
description: Cybersecurity is the practice of protecting computer systems, networks, and data from theft, damage, or unauthorized access.

name: Code Review
description: Code review is a systematic examination of computer source code. It is intended to find mistakes overlooked in initial development.

name: Code Refactoring
description: Code refactoring is the process of restructuring existing computer code without changing its external behavior.

name: Continuous Integration
description: Continuous Integration (CI) is a software development practice where code changes are automatically built, tested, and integrated into the shared repository.

name: Continuous Deployment
description: Continuous Deployment is a software development practice where every code change that passes automated testing is automatically deployed to production.

name: Code Quality
description: Code quality refers to the overall robustness, maintainability, readability, and performance of a software codebase.

name: Unit Testing
description: Unit testing is a software testing method where individual units or components of a software are tested in isolation.

name: Continuous Monitoring
description: Continuous monitoring involves the regular collection and analysis of data to evaluate the performance and security of a system.

name: Responsive Design
description: Responsive design is an approach to web design that makes web pages render well on a variety of devices and window or screen sizes.

name: User Experience (UX)
description: User Experience (UX) refers to a person's emotions and attitudes about using a particular product, system, or service.

name: User Interface (UI)
description: User Interface (UI) encompasses the visual elements, controls, and layouts through which a user interacts with a software or hardware.
